verses.kjv: O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.
verses.ct: If only you were like a brother to me, one who nursed at my mother's breast! Then if I found you out in public, I could kiss you, and no one would look down on me.

verses.kjv: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
verses.ct: I would take you by the hand and bring you into my mother's house, where she would teach me. I would give you spiced wine to drink, the fresh juice of my pomegranates.

verses.kjv: His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.
verses.ct: His left arm would cradle my head, and his right arm would hold me close.

verses.kjv: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.
verses.ct: I want you to promise me, young women of Jerusalem — don't stir up or awaken love until the time is right.

verses.kjv: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.
verses.ct: Who is this coming up from the desert, leaning on the one she loves? I woke your love under the apple tree — that's where your mother went into labor with you, where she gave birth to you.

verses.kjv: Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.
verses.ct: Place me like a seal over your heart, like a seal on your arm. Because love is as powerful as death, and its passion is as unyielding as the grave. Its fire blazes like an intense, raging flame.

verses.kjv: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.
verses.ct: Rushing waters cannot put out love, and rivers cannot wash it away. If someone offered everything they owned in exchange for love, they would be completely rejected.

verses.kjv: We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
verses.ct: We have a young sister whose body has not yet developed. What will we do for her when the day comes that someone asks to marry her?

verses.kjv: If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
verses.ct: If she proves to be like a wall, we will build silver towers on her. But if she proves to be like a door, we will barricade her with cedar planks.

verses.kjv: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
verses.ct: I am like a wall, and my breasts are like towers. So in his eyes, I became someone who brought him complete satisfaction.

verses.kjv: Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
verses.ct: Solomon owned a vineyard at Baal-hamon. He leased it out to caretakers, and each one was to pay 1,000 pieces of silver for its fruit.

verses.kjv: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
verses.ct: But my own vineyard is mine to give. You can have your 1,000 pieces, Solomon, and the caretakers can keep their 200.

verses.kjv: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.
verses.ct: You who spend your time in the gardens — our friends are listening for your voice. Let me hear it too.

verses.kjv: Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
verses.ct: Hurry to me, my love! Be like a gazelle or a young deer running across the mountains of spices.
